Class Enquiries

java.lang.Object
BTO.Enquiries
All Implemented Interfaces:
Search<Integer>
public class Enquiries extends Object implements Search<Integer>
Represents an enquiry submitted by a user regarding a BTO project. Each enquiry contains a user-submitted question or concern, the user ID of the enquirer, and optionally a reply from an officer or manager. The enquiry is linked to a specific BTO project by ID, and can be edited or deleted by the enquirer. Replies can only be submitted by users with the "officer" or "manager" role. Each enquiry is uniquely identified by an auto-incremented enquiry ID. This class supports printing formatted enquiry information for display purposes.
Author:
Kah Teck, Keanan, Javier, Junnoske, Kevin

    • Enquiries

      public Enquiries(String enquiry, int enquirierId, int btoId)
      Constructs a new enquiry associated with a given BTO project and enquirer.
      Parameters:
      enquiry - the question or message submitted by the user
      enquirierId - the ID of the user submitting the enquiry
      btoId - the ID of the BTO project this enquiry is about

      Returns:
      the replier's user ID, or -1 if no reply has been made

    • setReply

      public void setReply(String reply, int id, String role)
      Sets a reply to the enquiry if the role is authorised. Only "officer" or "manager" roles can reply.
      Parameters:
      reply - the reply content
      id - the user ID of the replier
      role - the role of the replier ("officer" or "manager")

    • printEnquiry

      public void printEnquiry()
      Prints the enquiry details to the console. Includes the enquiry ID, message, and optionally the reply if present.
